dt: {bc}to draw air into and {d_link|expel|expel} it from the lungs {bc}{sx|respire||}
{bc}to take in oxygen and give out carbon dioxide through natural processes
{bc}to permit passage of air or vapor
{bc}to be cooled or dried by air that passes by or through

dt.t: clothing that allows your skin to {wi}breathe{/wi}

dt: {bc}to develop flavor and {d_link|bouquet|bouquet} by exposure to air

dt.t: a personality that {wi}breathes{/wi} and that distinguishes his work

dt: {bc}to instill by or as if by breathing

dt.t: don't {wi}breathe{/wi} a word of it to anyone

dt: {bc}to spend a great deal of time, thought, or effort on (something) {bc}to be wholly devoted to (some interest or activity)

dt.t: The Virginia native may not {wi}breathe{/wi} basketball 24-7 … but during games and practice, his focus is second to none.
As with visiting companies, one of the key reasons for going to conferences is to avoid the tunnel vision that can overcome managers who {phrase}live and breathe{/phrase} their business.

dt: {bc}to threaten especially in attack or pursuit
{bc}to keep one under close or constant {d_link|surveillance|surveillance}
{bc}to enjoy relief (as from pressure or danger)

quotes.t: Earth is surrounded by a life-giving gaseous envelope called the atmosphere. This thin blanket of air is an integral part of the planet. It not only provides the air that we {qword}breathe{/qword} but also acts to protect us from the dangerous radiation emitted by the Sun.
However, liquid nitrogen is not used for higher levels of fog because {qword}breathing{/qword} this substance is unsafe. Dry ice is a safer material, and can be used either at ground level or higher.
… The tinder burned all right, but that was as far as I got. I blew on it, I {qword}breathed{/qword} on it, I cupped it in my hands, but no sooner did I add twigs than the whole thing went black.
No one was more grief-stricken by Lincoln's assassination than Stanton, who spoke the imperishable words as the president {qword}breathed{/qword} his last: "Now he belongs to the ages."

shortdef: to draw air into and expel it from the lungs : respire; broadly : to take in oxygen and give out carbon dioxide through natural processes
